post.body: I'd like to - what's the venue?
I think my youngest was quite excited to play with Tom's son - once he decided not to be shy in front of our visitors!
When my eyes get sore is a good reminder to have a break.
I appreciate your offer. Thnx.
Hmmmmm... that sounds pretty close to emotional blackmail 2 me.
Have to agree with @deangroom here - my wife thinks that mind reading was part of the deal.
Now you just have to work on your accent - try talking through your nose like I do.
My guess is from left to right - Steve, Tom and yourself? Hoping to host @tombarrett myself in the coming week.
Check my blog for my POV and some links (not advertising, I hope) to explain yr dilemma.
Just finished New Year's Day lunch at the in-laws - ate more than my share of the cherries.
Not going out anywhere for NYE - relaxing instead and traversing the web.
For stuff that doesn't fit within my professional interests I've started http://grahamwegner.weebly.com/ - mix&mash is the concept.
Great evening having @tombarrett and family over for dinner whilst he was in Adelaide.
Relaxing watching the kids in the inflatable pool - just hot enough.
Waiting for it to get dark enough to take kids out to see Xmas lights.
Back from the very unplugged town where my parents live - my Dad still calculates his GST using his working Windows 3.1 PC!
Might go and play NFS on PS2 - I know I'm a few years behind in my console gaming experiences.
When will people learn that Facebook is not a smart place to thumb your nose at your employer? http://snipurl.com/8v9v2
Waiting for the floor to dry after my mopping - oldest son reading in his room, wife and youngest out to play lunch - so checking the web.
Catching up with a teaching mate tomorrow for golf - hiring a golf cart so we can talk more - walking can be anti-social when I hit the ball
